DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Original Quantity Storage Unit of Measure
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unit of the quantity of specimen originally stored.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The amount, including units, of something as first specified

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: The amount, including units, of something as first specified

Concepts.definition: The amount, including units, of something as first specified.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/24/22 jk Biospecimen CSI removed; if reused in future ownership should be transferred.  10/29/19 jk released per MCL SME (Maureen/Kristen) review.   9/10/19 jk transferred ownership to MCL; part of EDRN bulk load.  2/28/17 changed context from Test to EDRN. jk

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Unit of the quantity of a specimen._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume accepted for use with the SI and equal to one millionth of a liter (10E-6 liter).

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume accepted for use with the SI and equal to one millionth of a liter (10E-6 liter).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

Concepts.definition: The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.

Concepts.definition: The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to 10E-9 gram, or one millionth of a milligram.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one billionth of a gram (10E-9 gram) or one thousandth of a milligram.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified used as a standard measurement of same kinds, such as pound or kilogram in measuring weight. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ValueDomain.origin: MCL:Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screened Lesions
